intro: Spennera pendulifolia, commonly known as the hanging spennera, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pendulous inflorescences, which consist of small, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Spennera pendulifolia thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found growing in rocky or forested areas. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and specialized horticulture.
